What

Phlorida is a normal rails3 application that comes packaged with some gems that may speed up your website development.

Why

Most of the time we (we intended as we, web developers) have to deal with the same kind of web application: a website where the customer has an admin area behind a secure authentication system, in which he can adds some pages, edit title and content, or add some items (products, projects, fruits, vegetables...whatever) in some categories. Maybe he wants to choose which page should be the homepage, or which items should have a photogallery, and which photos put in the photogallery. Well, Phlorida comes with a solution for this kind of website.

How

I've started Phlorida because i wanted an admin namespace in this web application written by Daniel Kehoe.Then I've added somes other features that i think i will reuse in my future projects. Here a short overview:
  • Authentication System through Devise
  • Role Management with CanCan
  • Categories organized in a tree structure using Ancestry as suggested in Episode 262 of Ryan Bates Railscasts
  • Twitter bootstrap with Bootstrap sass gems
  • Bootswatch themes with this gem
  • A Pages controller, with an homepage method, and the possibility to edit the page content with a wysiwyg html5 editor
  • A galleryable polymorphic association, in order to simply upload photos in a photogallery with paperclip , and show this photogallery in the front-end using Twitter bootstrap Carousel

Installation:

Clone the Phlorida repo in a local folder. Move into it and create a .rvmrc file and a gemset. 
rvm --rvmrc --create 1.9.3@yourapp
rvm gemset create yourapp
Run "bundle install" and check that everithing goes ok. Now, Phlorida comes with some data, like a user administrator and some pages, in order to run the application as soon as possible. You can remove or edit this data later. Let's create the database and add this data. 
rake db:schema:load
rake db:seed
Run the server and open the browser.Done!

Customization

Phlorida is, after all, a rails app with some gems and 4 resources. These are some small changements thought to run the app as soon as installed, that can easily be removed or edited:
  • I've mantained the registrable behaviour in Devise in order to allow the user to edit his profile but i've removed the possibility to sign up. I've adopted this solution
  • I've choosed the twitter bootswatch "Readable" theme. You can pick up another theme changing the word "readable" in the assets/stylesheets/application.css.scss file, with one of the availables themes
  • I've put a "Login" link on the front end, but there is also a /login route available in case you would remove the link.
  • In the application controller I've added a method to dynamically fetch the items needed for the menu. If you are not thinking to add pages or categories in the future, it's a good solution to write your pages and categories links statically in the _navigation partial, you will spare two queries.
  • If you want to add some css classes, use the base.css file, that I leave empty.

Something didn't work as described
